answerText: The Quaker Graveyard in Nantucket [10] "The Quaker Graveyard in Nantucket" is part of this author's collection Lord Weary's Castle. His teacher Allen Tate wrote the introduction to his first book, Land of Unlikeness, and he may be better known for his poem "For the Union Dead."
heading: VCU Closed  |2013 | Dartmouth A + WUSTL | 4 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: It is dedicated "For Warren Winslow, Dead at Sea." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem that describes sailors who cry "If God himself had not been on our side" while hunting for "the whited monster," a sperm whale. Its last section describes "the old mouth of the Atlantic" as the speaker looks at a cenotaph in the title location.
